II.iii.2.F.1.e
.
Effect of the Withdrawal of a Claim
Effective the date VA receives a request to withdraw a claim,
the claim ceases to exist
the adjudicatory process with respect to the claim stops, and
VA must treat the claim as if the claimant never filed it.
Important
:Â  If a claimant withdraws a claim, later refiles the same claim, and VA ultimately grants entitlement to the claimed benefit, disregard the date of receipt of the claim that was withdrawn when determining the effective date of entitlement.
title: M21-1, Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F - Withdrawal of Initial Claims
citation: Part II, Subpart iii, Chapter 2, Section F
